summary:
Stephanie is an experienced researcher, knowledge manager, policy expert and product owner. She has worked for fifteen years for clients such as NGOs, consultancy firms, the European Commission, governments. She is mostly interested in part-time and remote work opportunities, and she is available per november '23.

She has implemented ground-breaking ICT projects. She works on content writing, content management, software testing, e-governance and software development. She has given trainings to different NGOs and at the Dutch government. 

Her analytical skills and translation (NL, ENG, FR, ES) skills make her an easy fit in international projects. Other skills include assisting with administrative and bookkeeping tasks and optimising the use of data and information. Areas of expertise include sustainability, education and entrepreneurship.

She owns a self-developed Mac app for business administration (B2B software development). She is usually busy with a wide variety of small business activities including website maintenance, user portal maintenance, cyber security protection, attending clients and managing the process of developing software liaising between clients and software developers. Through continued learning, investment and feedback we have increased sales and user-friendliness of this software. 

Since 2023 she started working part-time for the City Party of Nijmegen offering policy support.

She holds a Master’s and Advanced Master’s Degree in International Development, a first year diploma in physics, several software coding certificates and a certificate on solar energy. 

► Specialties: 

● Quantitative, qualitative analysis, multilingual & online research, capturing knowledge, lesson learning;
● Conduct research, use, test; portals, software, social media, online collaboration, ICT platforms;
● Co-develop, advise, implement knowledge management and organisational learning strategies, e-governance, KM Assessment; 
● Business processes, business administration, managing budgets, product development, managing research and software development teams, customer service;
● Fluent in Dutch, English, French and Spanish languages. Basic German, Portuguese, Italian.
● Basic software coding skills in HTML, PHP, CSS and Swift (iOS). 
● She can work with different project management tools. 

Websites:
www.createconsultancy.org / www.mac-boekhoudprogramma.nl / www.dutch-painting.com

treasury_media.title: Publication Master Thesis - Community Based Water Management in Malawi
treasury_media.description:
'The study brings together insights from various disciplines in a systematic fashion. It is theoretically sound and at the same time operational, reflecting experience on the ground. It is well written. It shows a good understanding of basic development issues and a commitment to the well being of people at the grassroots'. by Prof. Dr. Jan Pronk.

Described as a study of  ‘an important topic dealt with in a creative manner’ in the Broker.

awards.title: Positive review published in the Dutch Magazine 'MacFan'​.
awards.description: Independent reviewer on our bookkeeping software: "Easily accessible, very complete, clear explanations." .. "this app definitely has the potential of becoming THE bookkeeping software for freelancers". MacFan score: 8/10.

awards.title: Albert Heijn and ICCO winners of the Best New Partnership Award 2013
CIDIN Research Memorandum - Preface by Prof. Dr. Jan Pronk
awards.description:
My first thesis was published as the first in a series of Research memoranda by CIDIN. The thesis was highlighted in the Broker. Furthermore Prof. Dr. Jan Pronk (former Dutch minister of Development cooperation) wrote a preface:

The study by Stephanie Zwier on Community Based Water Management Systems brings together insights from various disciplines in a systematic fashion. It is theoretically sound and at the same time operational, reflecting experience on the ground. It is well written. It shows a good understanding of basic development issues and a commitment to the well being of people at the grassroots. 
Title: Community Based Water Management; wishful thinking or a way out?
An organisational and institutional analysis of Common Pool Resource (CPR) management with a livelihood approach.
http://www.createconsultancy.org/publications/
awards.issuer: Centre for International Development Issues Nijmegen - in affiliation with Centre for Social Research, University of Malawi

projects.title: Report writing and data analysis on education
projects.description:
My tasks in this project:
- Content check of information of 12 cases (Spanish) in Peru and Bolivia (e.g activities, lessons learned & challenges)
- Compilation of core information in a summarising document per country.

Dik Verboom (Senior Programme Manager Edukans): 'The reports are submitted and processed. I did not receive any questions on them, so it should be all right. On our cooperation I can only be positive. You got the job done in a short time span and it alleviated me considerably. I can really not think of any lessons to be learned or points for further improvement. You communicated on time and when needed, very customer-oriented. Thanks for the support'!

projects.title: Checklist on Organisational Capacity Assessment (COCA)
projects.description: The COCA check list is a document used by the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs to assess whether an organization has the capacity to spend funds appropriately and effectively. The COCA - check was approved. The endclient, SOS Children's Villages, now meets the threshold criteria for receiving Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs' funds.

projects.title: Blog on political debate
projects.description: I reported on a debate held in the run towards the European elections to promote an online voting website.

projects.title: Technical Vocational Education and Training (TVET) Gastronomy project Bolivia
projects.description: Writing on Edukans' didactical skills training in a gastronomy project 'Buen Apetito'.

projects.title: Women's political participation
projects.description: The ‘Respect for Women’s Political Rights’ programme (WPR) falls under the MFA Human Rights Fund 2014-2017 and has the aim of strengthening the political leadership of women in Colombia, Kenya and Tunisia.

projects.title: Writing track records on education
projects.description:
Writing track records on quality education for Edukans’ Connect4Change programmes (ICT), (‘BEQUIP’ and ‘MOSIQUE’) in a team.
Edukans website on Bequip: 'Between 2011 and 2015 Edukans trained 8,573 teachers in Ethiopia, Ghana, Malawi, Kenya, Uganda, Zambia, Bolivia, Peru. The teachers learned through our BEQUIP product to make use of ict and to make use of the active teaching and learning methodology'.

profile_positions.title: Researcher, Knowledge Manager, Public Policy Expert

profile_positions.description: Providing policy support in the municipality of Nijmegen. Nijmegen is a large city in the east of the Netherlands, located close to the German border. We discuss all areas of public policy; such as education, ICT, inclusion, social change, living, mobility, health care, the energy transition.
profile_positions.title: Policy Officer

profile_positions.description: Our business administration software 'Mac Boekhoudprogramma voor ZZP'ers' is specially designed for the business administration of Dutch entrepreneurs. This Mac App facilitates a quick and correct tax declaration in the Netherlands. Some Flemish entrepreneurs are also using our software for their administration in Belgium. My role involves; software management and testing for business administration and finance, collecting user feedback, leading and managing software development in a team (teambuilding, motivation, problem solving), investor, business development, sales, customer service, marketing and sales, conducting surveys, online research, developing training tutorials and videos on how to use this software, knowledge management, internal learning, search engine optimisation (SEO) and market analysis. Programming languages Swift Xcode for a Mac App and PHP.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director / Product Owner / Business Administration, Software Management

profile_positions.description: Creation of art and paintings, Dutch Painting webshop to open soon at www.dutch-painting.com .
profile_positions.title: Artist

profile_positions.description:
My role: Take part in a pool of "non-key experts", if the client submits a request for expertise that meets my profile, then I will contribute to this project (winning bid by Stantec in this EU tender).

The "Knowledge Hub Digital" facility (KHD) focuses on Sub-Saharan Africa and Neighbourhood and Enlargement regions. 
Specific objectives include: 
1) A knowledge hub on digital for development, space and Science, Technology and Innovation (STI) is established, 
2) The role of EU as a global actor is strengthened through improved collaboration with EU and non-EU actors and 
3) Knowledge Management regarding the European Commission's role in the Digital for Development and STI domain is strenthened.
profile_positions.title: Non Key Expert for the European Commission on EU Knowledge HUB Digital, assigned by Stantec

profile_positions.description:
Methodological and Knowledge Sharing Support for EU External Interventions, DG INTPA
•	Co-delivered a series of several interactive webinars of 2 hours each on digital connectivity and raise awareness on digital connectivity in least developed countries. Presenting an overview of EU policy on greening digital connectivity, the Green Deal, Global Gateway, data infrastructure, green data centres.
•	The overall objective was to enable EU Commission and Delegation staff to identify the opportunities and challenges for digital connectivity in their geographic area. 
•	Tools and methods: Powerpoint presentations, group discussions, quizzes, evaluation
•	The overall training received a score of 8,4 in an evaluation conducted by the EC with 14 participants at the end of the training participating in the evaluation.
profile_positions.title: Senior Digital Policy Expert for the European Commission (DG INTPA), assigned by Ecorys

company.name: EPRD Office for Economic Policy and Regional Development Ltd.

profile_positions.description: Member of the team in charge of conducting a study to explore data availability of 28 Member States of the European Union, in order to develop indicators for evaluating the performance of the ‘Remedies Directives.’ Partner organisations were RPA and Milieu. This (home-based) study took stock of statistics collected on public procurement remedies in 28 Member States and identified opportunities for improvement. I was in charge of the contribution from the Netherlands, my partner organisation was the Dutch Ministry of Economic Affairs.
profile_positions.title: National Expert (Researcher) on procurement procedures hired by EPRD for the European Commission

profile_positions.description: Coordinated translation, ICT and research services (Dutch, French, Spanish, Arabic, English). Media coverage of news in Spain and acted as a backup to report on news in the Benelux. Monitoring of and reporting on trends and (online) publications. Home-based or remote assignment. Translating, summarising texts and trends from Dutch, French and Spanish (some German, Arabic as well) into English. I received extensive training on neutral writing for government purposes.
profile_positions.title: Independent Contractor, Online Researcher International Security (Spanish, English, Dutch, French)

profile_positions.description:
Facilitated a team-building process of an international virtual team, working as an online researcher on climate change.
● Provided technical assistance and co-developed an online pilot platform.
● Built the capacity of team-members, stimulated learning and gave trainings.
● Facilitated learning, designed surveys, conducted online research and I wrote on best practices.
profile_positions.title: Teambuilding and Climate Change Expert at Create Consultancy, hired by FSAS (by ICCO Cooperation)

profile_positions.description: Created an online platform, wrote case studies on different public-private partnerships, conducted research, designed surveys and facilitated learning (9.3/10 score), assigned by the Dutch NGO ICCO Cooperation.
profile_positions.title: Capacity Building Expert at Create Consultancy, hired by FSAS (on behalf of ICCO Cooperation)

profile_positions.description: Research on international cooperation, ICT support and trainings to senior policy staff members, knowledge management related activities.
profile_positions.title: Independent Consultant at Create Consultancy, hired by the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs

volunteer_experiences.role: Coordinator Children's Sponsored Walk for Water Projects in Africa and Asia
volunteer_experiences.description: Coordinated a sponsorship walk with 3300 children on World Water day 2006, assigned by Aqua4all. Fundraised 256.000 Euros for water projects in Africa and Asia.

Built the first canoe dock at Edirisa used for trekking and canoeing on Lake Bunyonyi in a small team. Edirisa is described on its website www.edirisa.org as being envisaged as a social enterprise (non-profit company), because they have concluded that business-oriented activities are the best approach for long-term social and economic development. Edirisa organises canoe trips (ecotourism), in Uganda and Rwanda. Edirisa also organises multimedia projects and offers budget accommodation at Lake Bunyonyi in Uganda.
Constructed houses in Chilean slums in a team of students.
Fed the homeless, cared for orphaned and handicapped children.
Assisted with the integration of a young asylum seeker in the Netherlands, a 'buddy' project.
